subject: Programming
title: What Algorithms Actually Are
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Algorithms Actually Are.

hook.text: You follow algorithms every day â€” recipes, driving directions, morning routines.

buildup.text: An algorithm is a finite set of clear steps that transforms an input into an output.

discovery.text: The key word is finite. An algorithm must always terminate. Infinite loops don't count.

twist.text: Some problems have no algorithm at all. They're provably unsolvable by any computer.

climax.text: Knowing which problems can be solved is just as important as solving them.

punchline.text: An algorithm is a recipe that always finishes.

quiz.question: What key property must every algorithm have?
options: It must be written in code
It must run on a computer
